alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 27 at 9:58PM EST until February 02 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. .Water from recent rainfall and snowmelt continues to work down the Grand River. Rises in river levels at Comstock Park may reach Flood Stage in the coming days. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON TO FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon to Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of homes along Abrigador Trail. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:24 PM EST Saturday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached early Monday afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued late Sunday night at midnight EST.
